description: A collection of circles in a triangular formation with a square formation attached below it; there are also two backward, capital L-shaped formations, each stemming from a bottom corner of the square formation. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a very small black triangle in the top right corner of the square formation and a slightly larger black triangle in the bottom left corner of the square formation.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
